disease: Basal cell carcinoma of skin of right upper eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Bleeding
symptoms.pattern: May occur if the center of the tumor becomes necrotic

symptoms.name: Change in size, color, or appearance
Madarosis (loss of eyelashes)
symptoms.pattern: In the area of the lesion

physical_findings: Slightly pigmented area in the lateral right upper eyelid with central ulceration, rolled edges, and loss of eyelashes (madarosis) in the area of the lesion
Small translucent nodule or papule with pearly outer margins
White-pink to yellow plaque with indistinct clinical margins and no obvious ulceration (morpheaform type)
risk_factors: Ultraviolet light (particularly UVB) induced damage to the epidermis
Defects of the PTCH gene located on chromosome 9q22.3

supportive: Clinical suspicion based on physical examination findings and risk factors

differential_diagnoses: Any benign or malignant condition of the eyelid skin
